isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 5.2 PRO-LINK 9000 ELECTRONIC SERVICE TOOL OPERATION - SERVICE TOOL FUNCTIONS - CUSTOM DATA LIST

svcprocinfo.para:
This selection enables the technician to design a custom data list, placing data items in the list in the order that the technician chooses to view them. When the Custom Data List is selected from the Function Menu, the screen in Figure 5.35
is displayed.

svcsubproc.title: Display Standard
svcsubproc.para: The Pro-Link stores in memory both the Standard Data List and one Custom Data List created by the technician. Selecting Display Standard selects the default list configuration for viewing and printing data lists. Pressing the "ENTER" key presents Diagnostic Data on the display in the Standard format for viewing.

svcsubproc.title: Display Custom
svcsubproc.para: Selecting Display Custom, selects the list configuration created with the Edit Custom menu selection. The Pro-Link displays Diagnostic data on the Pro-Link screen in the chosen custom format. If no custom list exists, the Standard List is displayed.

svcsubproc.title: Edit Custom
svcsubproc.para:
Selecting Edit Custom enables the technician to configure how he wants to view Diagnostic Data on the Pro-Link screen and/or from a printer. The editing screen is shown in Figure 5.36
.

figure.caption: Figure 5.36 - Pro-link Edit Custom Data Screen

svcsubproc.para: The table below shows the keys used for creating the Custom Data List and the result of the key.
→ Scrolls up Current Line number and
ENTER Accepts the Current Line number and
To create a custom Data List:

step1.para: Select the desired data line as the Current Line number.
Select the desired parameter to be displayed on the line.
Press the ENTER key. No change to the data list occurs unless ENTERis pressed.

svcsubproc.title: Reset Custom
svcsubproc.para:
This selection resets the Custom Data list back to the Standard List form. When selected, the following screen is displayed ( Figure 5.37
).

figure.caption: Figure 5.37 - Pro-link Reset Custom Data Screen

svcsubproc.para: No is the default action. Reset the Custom Data List to the Standard List by pressing the ← key to Select YES, then press the "ENTER" key.

note.para: If the Custom Data List is reset to the Standard List form, the Custom List is lost and must be recreated.
